Availability of clean water sources may be insufficient or contaminated, leading to water scarcity.
Costs of implementing and maintaining a clean water initiative could be high and a source of financial concern.
Inadequate infrastructure, such as water treatment plants, sewage systems, and distribution networks, may hinder progress.
Government intervention or lack thereof may pose a challenge in establishing and sustaining the initiative.
Cultural or traditional practices, such as open defecation or ritual bathing, may make maintaining clean water more difficult.
